trends: There have been no other sightings in North Charleston
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting Details Not sure if date is accurate but it was late 2006. One evening I stepped outside to smoke a ciggy and look at the stars (it was clear skies)and noticed an odd blinking object located somewhat above the Charleston Air Force Base. It was a pure white blink with a 7-10 second single blink pattern. I could not see any physical details as it was too high to see clearly. It was nearly overhead. As I watched it move slowly towards the north I noticed 4 other lights behaving the same way. After a minute or two, they had assembled together into a circle, hovering still and forming a circular pattern. An occasional blue blink would occur from them. As I watched after a few minutes, they began to slowly disperse and vanished upwards (I noticed the flashing becoming dimmer and dimmer and smaller). I'm prior Navy so I am familiar with plane lighting, and this had no known aircraft lighting or flight patterns. I heard no noises or felt no environmental phenomena. I took no pictures as I did not own a camera at that time. I had always suspected we were not alone in the universe, but I had not seen any in my life until that point. I kept it to myself and eventually forgot about it until recently.
